StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateCounselingRecord]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@CounselingID uniqueidentifier, @TrainingFileID uniqueidentifier, @RecordDate date.me, @Subject varchar(500), @Remarks varchar(1500), @RecruiterSignatureId uniqueidentifier = null, @SncoicSignatureId uniqueidentifier = null, @UpdateUserId uniqueidentifier
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF EXISTS(SELECT ID FROM [RSSOSS].[USMC].[Counseling] WHERE ID = @CounselingID) BEGIN -- if @intCount > 0, then the Record already exists. UPDATE. UPDATE [RSSOSS].[USMC].[Counseling] SET RecordDate = @RecordDate, Subject = @Subject, Remarks = @Remarks, RecruiterSignatureID = @RecruiterSignatureId, NCOICSignatureID = @SncoicSignatureId, LastUpdatedDate = GETDATE(), LastUpdatedBy = @UpdateUserId WHERE ID = @CounselingID END ELSE BEGIN -- if @intCount = 0, then the Record does not exist. INSERT. INSERT INTO [RSSOSS].[USMC].[Counseling] (ID, TrainingFileID, RecordDate, Subject, Remarks, LastUpdatedDate, LastUpdatedBy) VALUES (@CounselingID, @TrainingFileID, @RecordDate, @Subject, @Remarks, GETDATE(), @UpdateUserId)
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
